Medium: Ink and gold on paper; leather binding
Heilbrunn Timeline of Art History: Astronomy and Astrology in the Medieval Islamic World
Description: This book, based on the Almagest of the Greek astronomer Ptolemy, concerns the forty‑eight constellations known as the Fixed Stars, which, according to the medieval conception of the universe, inhabited the eighth of the nine spheres surrounding the earth. The constellations each appear twice in mirror image, shown as observed from the earth and from the sky.
